shortDescription: I was the web developer for D150 Fueling where I compiled the ideas of the owners and developed their website using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap.
moreDetails: Led the campaign to design, develop, and host D150Fueling which has reached 1,000 clicks and 40,000 impressions since tracking started 6/2019
Applied knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap to shape the startup owners’ ideas to build a well-designed and useful web presence
Remote sprints with weekly in-person scrum meetings to confirm product vision

employer: Univeristy of Delaware Vertically Integrated Projects
shortDescription: I was one of the two software developers for a multi-disciplinary research group studying vehicle detection and traffic analysis using YOLO v2 and OpenCV python scripts on drone footage.
moreDetails: Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team to study object detection using drone footage for traffic analysis for the Delaware Department of Transportation
Scripted using Python, OpenCV, and YOLO v2 to perform real-time detection of vehicles from video files using the University of Delaware’s supercomputer

shortDescription: I worked in a small intern team on projects like refactoring large C# code bases and developing front ends using Angular.
moreDetails: Renewed a client’s back-end code base for truckload shipment tracking by refactoring, testing, and debugging legacy C# code that contains over 2,000 live API connections
Refreshed EDSI’s in-house employee ticketing system’s front-end using Angular 4
Gained industry experience using version control, scrum, Angular, and C# to develop enterprise-level software
